page.title: 14GOLF CLUB SECRETARY
page.content: Brancepeth's 18 hole golf course was once the scene of many top tournaments in the North of England.It was formed in 1924 when the land bought from McLaren's farm by the castle owner.The course follows the natural layout of the land.As secretary, Mr.Carver lives at the club which has 550 members. Nine employees work all the year and temporary staff are taken on during the busy March-October time. He teaches novices and the club has many visitors who pay Â£9.00 per round. There is a small ravine on the course and one day a storm washed away the bridge leaving some golfers stranded. Mr.Carver would like to see the course improved and despite the fact that there is little to do in the village, he would not like to move.
